channel.title: Fxiing null items
channel.description: i used galkons base. I have a ton of null items, and i havent done any coding in a while so i forget what to do. Anyone help? :D

item.title: Fxiing null items
item.dc:creator: @Fun_4_me_not_u Fun 4 me not u
item.description:
@Fun_4_me_not_u wrote:

Hmm…

I really don’t know, I don’t have classfile8.

If you have an item class, search for this.(Don’t search for it, it should be obvious to see it.)

item = item number, ie 1 Item name Item desc.

If you see that, goto the bottom, and just copy what u see above it, following the pattern.

Soz if this doesn’t make too much sense, read my sig lol

Read full topic

item.title: Fxiing null items
item.dc:creator: @Zombiedevice Zombiedevice
item.description:
@Zombiedevice wrote:

[quote=“Fun 4 me not u, post:2, topic:217833”]I think null items are when the item hasn’t been coded into base, therefore making it a null.

In order to fix, try adding the item in your item.cfg list and see if that works. If it doesn’t, you will have to add codes to galkons base.[/quote]

No.

And you need to add the items into Class8 with the models.

Read full topic

item.title: Fxiing null items
item.dc:creator: @Fun_4_me_not_u Fun 4 me not u
item.description:
@Fun_4_me_not_u wrote:

I think null items are when the item hasn’t been coded into base, therefore making it a null.

In order to fix, try adding the item in your item.cfg list and see if that works. If it doesn’t, you will have to add codes to galkons base.

Read full topic
